description.narrative: Goal Overview: The project will empower the farmers to become active and contribute efficiently to the development of their communities. It is the aim of the Farmers’ Club project to assure food security in farmers’ households by improving their production and to significantly increase their incomes with the organization of sales committees and cooperatives.

Project Plan: The project will be led by a Project Leader who will be responsible of the overall activities of the project and he will report to the National Country Office of HPP-Congo. 4 Farmers Instructors at 1/unit will be responsible each of 250 farmers organized in 5 clubs, educating and assisting them technically for a better agricultural production. The Farming Instructors will report to the Project Leader. The project will have 20 Sales Committees and 20 Farmers’ Club committee s with a total of 100 members who will be responsible for coordinating activities in the Farmers’ Clubs with the assistance of Farming Instructors.

Summary: The project has organized 1,000 Farmers in 20 clubs of 50 members/farmers with the aim to assist them improving their agricultural practices, economy and living conditions, which is a direct response to the Millennium Development Goals: “Eliminate extreme poverty and hunger” and “ensure a sustainable environment”. The project is organized in 4 units of 250 farmers in 5 clubs led by a farming instructor.

Target Groups: The project has organized 1,000 Farmers in 20 clubs of 50 members/farmers with the aim to assist them improving their agricultural practices, economy and living conditions. The project will empower the farmers to become active and contribute efficiently to the development of their communities. Illiterate farmers are encouraged to register for the literacy courses.
